title: Swami Gyananand Shiksha Parishad Trust - Arunachal Pradesh
summary: Swami Gyananand Shiksha Parishad Trust is an educational trust organization operating in Arunachal Pradesh, India, dedicated to promoting education and cultural development in the region.

content.text: Swami Gyananand Shiksha Parishad Trust is a non-profit educational organization established in 2005 in Arunachal Pradesh, India. Founded by Swami Gyananand, the trust focuses on promoting quality education, preserving local culture, and supporting educational infrastructure development in northeastern India.

The trust's mission is to provide accessible quality education while preserving the rich cultural heritage of Arunachal Pradesh. The organization works to bridge the educational gap between urban and rural areas, with special emphasis on supporting underprivileged communities.

The trust operates multiple educational programs including scholarship schemes, teacher training workshops, infrastructure development projects, and community education centers. It has partnerships with various schools including Almonte Higher Secondary School.

Beyond formal education, the trust actively works to preserve and promote the indigenous cultures, languages, and traditions of Arunachal Pradesh. It organizes cultural events, documentation projects, and awareness programs to maintain the region's cultural identity.

Since its establishment, the trust has benefited thousands of students through its various programs. It has contributed to improving literacy rates, educational quality, and cultural awareness in remote areas of Arunachal Pradesh.
